thread.title: Premier League clubs on red alert as Mino Raiola demands £165,000-a-week for AC Milan teen sensation Gianluigi Donnarumma
thread.title_full: Premier League clubs on red alert as Mino Raiola demands £165,000-a-week for AC Milan teen sensation Gianluigi Donnarumma

author: hmoore
title: Premier League clubs on red alert as Mino Raiola demands £165,000-a-week for AC Milan teen sensation Gianluigi Donnarumma
text:
EFL DONNA DEMANDS Premier League clubs on red alert as Mino Raiola demands £165,000-a-week for AC Milan teen sensation Gianluigi Donnarumma 
THE 17-year-old goalkeeper is being chased by a number of Premier League clubs Gossip Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments SUPER agent Mino Raiola has put Premier League clubs on high alert after making huge demands for AC Milan Gianluigi Donnarumma. 
Raiola is currently negotiating a new deal for the 17-year-old – but has told the Serie A club that Donnarumma wants £165,000-a-week. 
Gianluigi Donnarumma is locked in contract talks with AC Milan Getty Images 4 Mino Raiola has told Milan that Donnarumma wants £165,000-a-week 
The Italian giants are currently in the midst of a take over by a Chinese investor and the youngster’s agent, Mino Raiola is refusing to discuss a new contract for Donnarumma until the the take over is complete. 
Reports suggest his initial demand is a four-year contract worth £165,000-a-week, this would extend his current deal that was signed in 2015 and was the goalkeepers first professional contract. Keep up to date with ALL the AC Milan news, gossip and transfers on our club page 
Milan are extremely unlikely to accept these conditions though – turning the heads of many big clubs around Europe. Getty Images 4 Donnarumma has emerged as a star in the last year Juventus are keen to bring in the young star to replace the legendary Gianluigi Buffon when he eventually retires or moves on from the Italian Champions. Outside of Italy two of the Premier Leagues biggest clubs are interested in securing the signature of the Milan Goalkeeper. EPA 4 Donnarumma has already made his Italy debut Both Chelsea and Manchester United are keen to bring in the player dubbed the new “Buffon” as they look to bring in young backups for their world class keepers. However the keeper is reluctant to accept anything but first team football and unless these teams lose their keepers that is an unlikely outcome. Since Donnarumma made his debut he has started 49 games and earned 2 caps for his country. AC Milan perform haka ahead of playing Carpi
